title: GERENTE - RIO DE JANEIRO/RJ - ZONA NORTE
description:
Job Description

Venha fazer parte do time da maior rede de joalherias da América Latina! Com mais de 60 anos de história, desenvolvemos um portfólio de marcas – Vivara, Life by Vivara, Vivara Watches, Vivara Fragrances e Vivara Accessories, com foco em joias de ouro, joias de prata, relógios e acessórios.

Aqui você encontra um ambiente dinâmico, diverso, repleto de desafios e com muitas oportunidades de crescimento. Se você se considera uma pessoa criativa, resiliente, gosta de atuar como dona do negócio e é movida por resultados, já tem meio caminho andado.

Na Vivara, acreditamos na inclusão e na diversidade, e as apoiamos em todas as suas formas de expressão para construir um lugar em que todas as pessoas se sintam bem-vindas. Recriminamos qualquer tipo de discriminação, seja por idade, orientação sexual, identidade ou expressão de gênero, cor, etnia, deficiência ou religião.

Vem brilhar com a gente! #VemPraVivara

Responsibilities and assignments

junto ao nosso time, a atuação da Gerente de Loja tem papel imprescindível na gestão da equipe de vendas, sendo a principal motivadora para desenvolver o máximo potencial da equipe; sempre zelando pela excelência no atendimento, a fim de promover aos nossos clientes a melhor experiência de compra.

Funções atribuídas:
  • Responsável por supervisionar o trabalho das atendentes ou vendedoras, delegando atribuições, cobrando resultados e avaliando desempenho; elaborando planos de incentivo às atendentes ou vendedoras;
  • Detectar necessidades de treinamento e capacitação profissional da equipe de vendas;
  • Será corresponsável pela contratação de equipe.
Requirements And Qualifications
  • Escolaridade necessária: Ensino Superior completo - Obrigatório;
  • Experiência necessária em vendas;
  • Experiência necessária em Gestão de Pessoas;
  • Disponibilidade e flexibilidade em seus horários para atuar aos finais de semana e feriados na Escala 6X1.
Additional information
  • Vale-Refeição
  • Assistência médica e Odontológica
  • Vale-Transporte
  • Wellhub e Totalpass
  • Desconto em Produtos Vivara e Life
  • Seguro de Vida
  • Day Off de Aniversário
Brilhe na Vivara!
Somos a maior rede de joalherias da América Latina, com mais de 60 anos de liderança no segmento. Tudo isso é fruto do talento dos mais de 5.400 colaboradores e colaboradoras que, diariamente, atuam com o propósito de tornar cada história única e especial. Estamos presentes em todos os estados brasileiros e no Distrito Federal, com mais de 420 pontos de venda, entre lojas Vivara, lojas Life By Vivara e quiosques. As nossas marcas estão associadas a produtos democráticos, com design moderno e de alta qualidade, que podem ser acessados por diversas pessoas e acompanham nossos clientes em diferentes momentos da vida.

Além disso, temos uma fábrica própria, onde produzimos com cuidado e dedicação cada uma de nossas joias, garantindo a qualidade e o design que são a marca da Vivara.

Aqui na Vivara, acreditamos que Feito (rápido) é melhor que perfeito , que é proibido complicar , e que devemos ter conversas difíceis quando necessário. Aprendemos sempre com cada experiência, o que nos permite evoluir constantemente e entregar o melhor. #J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Operador de Máquina Sr
description:
Descrição : A Zydus busca Operador de Máquina SR.

Descrição de Atividades:

  1. Operação de equipamentos de compressão de sólidos orais;
  2. Ajustar os parâmetros dos equipamentos em conformidade com as especificações estabelecidas para cada produto, de acordo com os procedimentos padrões e Instruções de Fabricação e Embalagem, para certificar-se de que os parâmetros utilizados estejam conforme estabelecidos para o produto;
  3. Cumprir procedimentos a fim de conferir e garantir que não ocorra não conformidade;
  4. Realizar e verificar a operação, limpeza e desinfecção da área limpa;
  5. Preenchimento de documentação técnica, de acordo com as boas práticas de fabricação (BPF).

Outros requisitos :

  1. Conhecimento em Boas Práticas de Fabricação e nos procedimentos operacionais padrões pertinentes à Fabricação de produtos na forma farmacêutica de Sólidos Orais.
  2. Conhecimentos técnicos de Limpeza, Operação e Ajustes de Equipamentos de Fabricação de Sólidos Orais como: Compressor, Granulador (High shear), Leito Fluidizado, Estufa de secagem, amassadeira, granulador rotativo e misturador em V.

Indústria farmacêutica multinacional indiana do Grupo Zydus, presente em cerca de 50 países e com médio porte no Brasil. Dedicada à vida e comprometida na formação de comunidades mais saudáveis globalmente. Em 2004, o grupo começou suas atividades no Brasil. Atua com medicamentos de marca e genéricos no Brasil, onde possui 3 unidades físicas, incluindo escritório na Barra da Tijuca, fábrica na Ilha do Governador e Centro de Distribuição em Serra-ES.

title: Ux designer senior hibrido rj
description:
Nosso cliente é: Uma consultoria de inovação tecnológica com uma equipe altamente qualificada que ajuda as empresas a acelerar para a transformação digital.

Missão: Desenhar, desenvolver, implementar e testar soluções tecnológicas inovadoras que potencializem o desenvolvimento dos clientes e sociedade.

Cultura: Acreditam que o sucesso resulta do bem-estar dos colaboradores e, por isso, tem também como filosofia construir um ambiente de confiança onde se sintam realizados, integrados e ativos na cultura da empresa.

Visão Geral da Posição:

Estamos à procura de um UX Designer Sênior para atuar em uma squad multidisciplinar dedicada ao desenvolvimento de um produto inovador com foco em inteligência artificial. O profissional será responsável por liderar a concepção e evolução da experiência do usuário, garantindo usabilidade, acessibilidade e alinhamento com os objetivos do negócio.

Responsabilidades:
  • Liderar a pesquisa e análise de necessidades dos usuários.
  • Criar fluxos de navegação, protótipos interativos e wireframes de alta fidelidade.

title: Journalist and Teacher
description:
Join Our Team as a Journalist and Teacher for Foreigners at Rio & Learn!

Do you love sharing Brazil’s vibrant culture, news, and stories with the world? Are you passionate about engaging an international audience with fresh and captivating content? This is your chance to help foreigners discover everything that makes Brazil and Rio de Janeiro extraordinary!

We're building a platform to inform and inspire foreigners about the amazing things happening in Brazil. As a journalist with us, you’ll craft compelling stories and occasionally teach Portuguese to those eager to learn. Does this excite you? Let’s dive in!

Responsibilities:
  • Research and write engaging news articles about Brazil and Rio de Janeiro, focusing on topics that resonate with a foreign audience.
  • Use AI tools and search strategies to find trending and relevant news.
  • Create content that encourages readers to connect more deeply with Brazil.
  • Teach Portuguese to foreigners when needed, blending creativity and enthusiasm into your lessons.
  • Help build a platform that excites and informs. We aim to spark a global curiosity about Brazil.
  • Achieve performance-based goals to grow our readership and improve engagement.
Qualifications:
  • Native Portuguese speaker (essential for teaching Portuguese effectively).
  • Proven experience in journalism, blogging, or creating news content.
  • Advanced English skills to write for an international audience.
  • Proficiency with AI tools and research techniques for content creation.
  • A creative and curious mindset with strong storytelling skills.
  • Experience teaching or working with foreigners would help you stand out.
Benefits:
  • A base salary of R$3,000, with the potential to earn up to R$1,000 more monthly, based on performance and goal achievements.
  • A dental insurance plan to keep you smiling! :)
  • A “Worker of the Month” prize valued at R$500 for outstanding performance.
  • The opportunity to work in the heart of Rio de Janeiro just steps from the beach in Copacabana.
  • Join a fun, dynamic team that values creativity, innovation, and learning.
  • Inspire foreigners to explore Brazil and learn Portuguese through your work.
  • A chance to grow your career while sharing the stories that make Brazil unique.

If this role excites you, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now to join Rio & Learn, and help bring Brazil’s incredible stories to an international audience while making a real impact.

title: Engenheiro Mecânico Sênior
description:
APRESENTAÇÃO :

Prazer, somos a IDG!
Somos uma empresa que se espelha em fazer a diferença, em ser a diferença no mercado.
Fundada em 1999, a IDG Engenharia e Consultoria vem crescendo e criando raízes em princípios sólidos, como valorização do colaborador e fornecimento de serviços especializados e com total qualidade a seus clientes.

ESCOPO DO SISTEMA DE GESTÃO : Elaboração de Projetos Industriais Mecânico, Hidráulico, Elétrico, Automação e Civil para as indústrias de Mineração, Siderurgia, Petroquímica, Celulose e outros; Prestação de Serviços de Gerenciamento de Implantação de projetos industriais nas áreas de Mineração, Siderurgia, Celulose e outros.

QUEM NOS INSPIRA?

  • Alguém que acredite na ética e transparência profissional;
  • Uma pessoa que abrace nossos valores e direcionadores de cultura;
  • Alguém que possua uma comunicação clara para que haja um processo mais assertivo e tenhamos como resultado celeridade e qualidade.
  • Alguém que tenha maturidade para lidar com um ambiente dinâmico;
  • Ah, E não podemos esquecer alguém que acredite em si mesmo e que curta se autodesenvolver, busque cada vez mais conhecimento em sua área e não possua medo de explorá-la. Alguém que goste de desafios como nós!

O QUE ESPERAMOS DE VOCÊ?

  • Formação em Engenharia Mecânica.
  • 10+ anos de experiência em engenharia industrial, preferencialmente no setor siderúrgico.
  • Domínio de softwares de modelagem 3D (Autodesk Inventor, SAP2000, ROBOT, etc.).
  • Conhecimento avançado em normas técnicas brasileiras e internacionais (NBR, AISC, AISE6, CMAA 70, etc.).
  • Experiência em cálculos estruturais, análise de elementos finitos (FEM) e projetos multidisciplinares.
  • Habilidades comprovadas em elaboração de especificações técnicas, memórias de cálculo e desenhos técnicos.
  • Capacidade de coordenação de equipes e projetos complexos.

MODALIDADE DE CONTRATAÇÃO:

  • PJ (Pessoa Jurídica)

HORÁRIO DE TRABALHO:

  • De segunda à quinta – 07:40 às 17:28 e Sexta 07:40 às 14:58

BENEFÍCIOS:

  • Seguro de vida;
  • Refeição na empresa;
  • Transporte fretado.

O QUE VOCÊ VAI FAZER?

  • Desenvolvimento de Projetos: Elaboração, revisão e consolidação de engenharia conceitual, básica e detalhada multidisciplinar. Desenvolvimento de projetos de implantação industrial, incluindo verificação de mecanismos cinemáticos, interferências e cálculos estruturais. Cálculos cinemáticos, dinâmicos, de resistência e flexibilidade para elementos de máquinas. Seleção de componentes mecânicos (redutores, acoplamentos, acionamentos, freios, engrenagens, correntes, etc.).
  • Análises e Especificações Técnicas: Análise de simultaneidades hidráulicas, pneumáticas e flexibilidade de tubulações. Elaboração de memórias de cálculo conforme normas brasileiras e internacionais (tensões, deformações, cálculos térmicos, hidráulicos, suportes, etc.). Verificação estrutural de galpões, edifícios e pontes rolantes (normas NBR, AISC, NBR8400, AISE6, CMAA 70). Cálculos de vasos de pressão conforme normas internacionais.
  • Coordenação e Planejamento: Elaboração de planos de coordenação entre especialidades (civil, elétrica, mecânica, tubulação, estruturas, etc.). Desenvolvimento de planos de cargas, chumbadores, calços e parafusos. Especificações técnicas para compra de equipamentos (redutores, motores elétricos, cilindros hidráulicos, correias transportadoras, etc.).
  • Documentação e Desenhos Técnicos: Execução de desenhos de fabricação e montagem mecânica, tubulação e elétrica. Desenvolvimento de projetos em 3D (preferencialmente utilizando Autodesk). Elaboração de animações, "As Built" e projetos de retirada de interferências. Revisão e atualização de documentos e desenhos existentes.
  • Acompanhamento e Suporte: Assistência durante a obra, comissionamento e colocação em marcha. Levantamento de campo e planejamento de alternativas de projeto. Garantia de que toda documentação elaborada seja 100% exequível.

NÓS TEMOS MUITO MAIS QUE UM PAPEL NA SUA VIDA!

title: Python Engineer - Remote Work | REF282633
description:
WinDifferent specializes in helping businesses achieve rapid and sustainable growth through our powerful proprietary marketing system. Our data-driven solutions generate positive engagement that leads to ready-to-close opportunities, massively expanding sales pipelines and enabling companies to scale faster than the competition.

As one of WinDifferent's best success stories, BairesDev helps us to find the best talent worldwide and invites them to explore our continually growing job opportunities.

Python Engineer at WinDifferent

Join us at the heart of innovation, where business, data, and technology converge to power our core systems. As a Python Engineer, you will be the sole backend engineer responsible for the CMApp, building and maintaining scalable solutions to support our business needs. If you are passionate about backend development, cloud computing, and building high-performance applications, we want you on this journey!

What you will do
  1. Develop and maintain robust and scalable backend solutions using Python, Django, and FastAPI.
  2. Implement and optimize database models, queries, and migrations in MySQL, ensuring data integrity and performance.
  3. Build and maintain RESTful APIs for seamless integration with frontend applications and third-party services.
  4. Design and implement serverless solutions using AWS services (Lambda, SES, S3, etc.).
  5. Write unit, integration, and performance tests to ensure code reliability, and efficiently debug and resolve issues.
  6. Work closely with frontend developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to translate requirements into technical solutions.
What we are looking for
  1. 4+ years of experience in backend software development.
  2. 3+ years of experience with Python.
  3. Hands-on experience with Django or FastAPI for web development.
  4. Proficiency in MySQL/PostgreSQL or other relational databases.
  5. 2+ years of experience with AWS services (Lambda, API Gateway, ALB, EC2, S3, CloudWatch).
Plus:
  1. Background in Machine Learning or Data Engineering is a strong advantage.
  2. 3+ years of hands-on experience with AWS is highly desirable.
How we do make your work (and your life) easier:
  1. 100% remote work.
  2. Work-from-home hardware setup.
  3. Flexible hours - make your schedule.
  4. PTO, parental leave, and other special leaves.
  5. English classes.
  6. Personal loans with 0% interest, following the company's policies.
  7. Udemy for Business (subject to manager's approval).
  8. An excellent compensation package — well above the market average.
  9. You can grow at the speed of your learning curve.
  10. An innovation-driven, diverse, and multicultural work environment that provides the support and resources for its professionals to thrive.
  11. The chance and resources to be a game-changer for one of America's fastest-growing companies.

Join a global team where your unique talents can truly thrive and make a significant impact!

Apply Now!

title: Engineering Manager for IAM (Identity and Access Management)
description:
Engineering Manager for IAM (Identity and Access Management)Join or sign in to find your next job

Join to apply for the Engineering Manager for IAM (Identity and Access Management) role at Canonical

Engineering Manager for IAM (Identity and Access Management)

1 day ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join to apply for the Engineering Manager for IAM (Identity and Access Management) role at Canonical

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.

We are hiring an Engineering Manager for IAM (Identity and Access Management) to build high-performing Go and Python services and secure identity and access management solutions that will be used across all company products. From Ubuntu One SSO to Juju, LXD and MAAS your team will define the way Canonical users, clients and community members access their favorite open source applications.

This is an opportunity for a software engineering manager with a passion for distributed systems operations to help us transform the future of identity management at Canonical. Experience in the identity and access management (IAM) field is desirable but not required. You will work with upstream open source projects, alongside internal teams to deliver high quality software that can be deployed on bare metal, public cloud and Kubernetes.

As the identity team engineering manager you will bring significant software development experience, Kubernetes knowledge and a keen eye for software design, performance and security. You will be responsible for working with product management to define the technical vision for the products, managing the team backlog, reviewing code and coaching younger team members.

You will also be involved in all the aspects of the software development process: you will design software, write high-quality code and tests, provide insightful code reviews, write documentation and help to troubleshoot issues.

In addition to the engineering behind the project itself, you'll have the chance to work with industry-leading teams inside Canonical, ensuring your work is backed by rock-solid data stores, and highly observable using our Kubernetes-based Observability stack. You'll work with broader open source communities, participating in "hackfest" events, webinars and conferences.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA or AMER regions.

What we are looking for in you

  • Proven experience hiring and leading a high performance software engineering team
  • Experience with Go and Python software development
  • Ability to design and implement complex, distributed system
  • Experience working with container technology and Kubernetes
  • Strong understanding of software/infrastructure security and performance
  • Experience designing and/or operating large scale distributed systems
  • Knowledge of identity and access management technologies and standards is desirable but not essential
  • Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
  • Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
  • Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
  • Ability to travel internationally twice a year for company events up to two weeks long

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

  • Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
  • Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
  • Annual compensation review
  • Recognition rewards
  • Annual holiday leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
  • Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
  • Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Account Executive II (Portuguese Speaking) Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
description:
Account Executive II (Portuguese Speaking)

**Please submit resume in English**

About Vimeo:

Vimeo is the world's leading all-in-one video SaaS solution, empowering video creators to tell exceptional stories and reach their audiences. As we expand our global presence, we're seeking passionate and driven individuals to join our team and support our LATAM business.

Your Impact:

As an Account Executive for Vimeo's LATAM team, you'll play a pivotal role in driving our expansion by introducing Vimeo's Enterprise and OTT offerings to a new market. You'll be responsible for building relationships with key decision-makers, understanding their unique video needs, and demonstrating how Vimeo's innovative solutions can elevate their business.

This position will manage Vimeo's New Business territory in Brazil, serving companies with under 1,000 employees. We are looking for candidates who are fluent in Portuguese.

What You'll Do:

  • Drive revenue growth by consistently exceeding sales quota targets for Vimeo Enterprise and Vimeo OTT.
  • Develop and nurture relationships with prospects and clients, acting as a trusted consultant to understand their business objectives and video challenges.
  • Master Vimeo's platform and articulate its unique value proposition to prospects, showcasing how our tools can streamline workflows, enhance video content, and expand audience reach.
  • Skillfully navigate the sales cycle, from lead generation and qualification to negotiation and close, ensuring a seamless and positive customer experience.
  • Maintain a deep understanding of the evolving video landscape, emerging technologies, and competitive offerings, positioning Vimeo as the go-to solution for businesses in LATAM.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product, and customer success, to share insights, drive innovation, and contribute to Vimeo's continued success in the LATAM market.

Skills and Knowledge You Possess:

  • 3+ years of Proven Success: Demonstrated track record of generating and closing new business in the SaaS industry, ideally within the LATAM market.
  • Entrepreneurial Spirit: Thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic, and ever-changing environment, embracing new challenges and opportunities with enthusiasm.
  • Customer-Centric Approach: Dedicated to understanding customer needs and delivering tailored solutions that drive business outcomes.
  • Exceptional Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills in Portuguese and English, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
  • Data-Driven: Proficient in using CRM tools (Salesforce) to manage pipelines, track progress, and analyze sales data.
  • Passion for Video: A genuine interest in the power of video and a desire to help businesses harness its potential to achieve their goals.
  • Team Player: Collaborative, supportive, and eager to contribute to a positive and high-performing team culture.
  • Language: Fluency in Portuguese and English

Bonus Points:

  • Existing Network: Established relationships with businesses and decision-makers in the Brazilian market.
  • Video Industry Expertise: Knowledge of online video, live streaming, advertising, and content distribution trends.
  • Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with video production, editing, and related technologies.
  • Methodology: Knowledge of MEDDPICC.

description:
A SANDECH foi fundada em 2008 no Rio de Janeiro, com foco na elaboração de projetos multidisciplinares para o setor industrial. Atendemos diversos setores da economia brasileira, como óleo e gás, químico e petroquímico, farmacêutico e siderúrgico. Desde nossa fundação, entregamos mais de 800 projetos, conquistando um portfólio de clientes de grande porte, como Petrobras, BRASKEM, Modec, PRIO, Nestlé e Gerdau.

Trabalhamos com tecnologias avançadas, como drones, laser scan, integração ao modelo BIM e óculos virtual. Nosso portfólio inclui grandes empresas, e buscamos profissionais comprometidos com excelência e inovação.

Somos certificados internacionalmente pela ABS Quality Evaluations na ISO 9001:2015 e possuímos um Sistema de Gestão da Qualidade (SGQ) aprovado por auditorias de cinco clientes, permitindo a execução de projetos críticos de engenharia. Nosso compromisso é com a excelência e inovação.

  • Disciplinas de projeto executivo e/ou BIM cursadas;

title: Aero Mechanical Field Service Engineer
description:
Would you like to lead a team to our customers in the field?

Would you like to be part of our Turbomachinery Process Solutions Product Line?

Be part of a successful team

Our Turbomachinery & Process Solutions team provides industry-leading products and services that optimize the extraction, production, and processing of energy. As a team with integrity, we create value through impactful decisions by effectively connecting ideas and people.

Partner with the best

As an Aeroderivative Turbine Mechanical Field Service Engineer, you will be the first point of contact for our global customers on-site. You will be responsible for leading activities, people, and ensuring HSE compliance to a high standard. Your work will include the installation, maintenance, and repair of Aeroderivative Turbines, including borescope inspections, blade work, combustion/hot section replacements, engine swaps, and other maintenance tasks. You will have opportunities to develop your product knowledge and technical skills in a dynamic, innovative environment.

As Mechanical Field Service Engineer , your responsibilities will include:

  • Providing technical direction for site activities to internal teams and skilled labor to ensure safety, compliance, and quality.
  • Performing mechanical and hydraulic maintenance, repair, or replacement of parts as directed.
  • Using hand tools and small power tools to conduct general maintenance of Aeroderivative Gas Turbines.
  • Executing on-site job duties, including subcontractor coordination and communication with customers and internal teams.
  • Troubleshooting complex mechanical and hydraulic issues on turbines.
  • Overseeing overhaul, troubleshooting, and commissioning of Aeroderivative products at customer sites.
  • Leading customer and contractor meetings to share updates and advise on technical solutions.
  • Ensuring internal training, compliance, and quality documentation are maintained according to standards.
  • Carrying out all activities safely, following environmental health & safety (EHS) guidelines and procedures.

Fuel your passion

To succeed in this role, you should have:

  • A degree in Mechanical Engineering or a technical qualification in Mechanics.
  • An active CREA or CFT certification.
  • Previous experience as a mechanical technician on aircraft engines, aero-derivative engines, or similar turbines.
  • Good mechanical/technical and communication skills.
  • Knowledge of installation and maintenance of rotating equipment, bolting, hydraulic bolting, flange management, small bore piping.
  • Experience with gas turbines is advantageous.
  • Experience working in energy or oil and gas environments.
  • A customer service mindset and experience leading clients through technical decisions.
  • Ability to communicate complex technical information effectively.
  • Deep awareness of HSE compliance and risks.
  • Self-motivation, decision-making skills, and innovative thinking.
  • Proficiency in English.
  • Willingness to travel globally up to 70% of the time.

Work in a way that works for you

We offer flexible working patterns, including flexible hours, to help you balance work and personal life.

Location: Macaé

Working with us

We prioritize the development, engagement, and well-being of our people, investing in health, training, and leadership development.

Benefits include:

  • Work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
  • Private medical care options
  • Life insurance and safety net programs
  • Financial programs and voluntary benefits

About Us

With operations in over 120 countries, we provide innovative energy solutions and are committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050. We seek passionate individuals eager to make energy safer, cleaner, and more efficient.

Join Us

If you want to make a difference in a global company with exciting opportunities, join us and grow with a team that energizes and inspires.

Baker Hughes is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Analista de business intelligence junior e pleno
description:
Você quer fazer parte de uma empresa de tecnologia que está há mais de 20 anos no mercado, que não apenas é parceira premier do Google Cloud, mas também já foi 4 vezes premiada como Partner of the Year? Uma empresa que, além de ser referência na sua área, valoriza e leva a sério o compromisso com cada IPNETER, possuindo há 5 anos consecutivos o selo Great Place To Work.

Somos comprometidos com a inclusão, abraçando todas as formas únicas de ser humano, independentemente de etnia, gênero, orientação sexual, idade, habilidades físicas ou mentais. Todas as nossas vagas são inclusivas. Aqui, reconhecemos e celebramos as diferentes identidades, experiências e talentos de cada pessoa que faz parte do nosso time.

Estamos com uma vaga aberta para Analista de Business Intelligence (Júnior e Pleno), que atuará dentro do nosso time de Delivery, sendo responsável por:

  1. Ler e explorar dados, origens e campos customizados no Tableau, incluindo aplicação de filtros e expressões LOD (Level of Detail);
  2. Conduzir a migração de dashboards e relatórios do Tableau para Looker, garantindo a correta replicação de funcionalidades e visualizações;
  3. Trabalhar de forma colaborativa com as equipes de BI, Desenvolvimento e Infraestrutura para garantir uma transição fluida;
  4. Desenvolver e manter modelos de dados no Looker (LookML), criando visualizações e relatórios alinhados às necessidades do negócio;
  5. Integrar e otimizar dados entre diferentes fontes no Looker, preservando qualidade, precisão e integridade durante a migração;
  6. Garantir que KPIs, métricas e dashboards do Tableau sejam corretamente traduzidos e configurados no Looker, com melhorias de performance e experiência do usuário;
  7. Fornecer suporte pós-migração, realizando testes, ajustes e melhorias com base no feedback dos usuários;
  8. Documentar todo o processo de migração, incluindo mudanças no modelo de dados, dashboards e processos.

Para atender às demandas da vaga, é necessário que o candidato possua:

  1. Formação em Análise e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas, Tecnologia da Informação, Engenharia da Computação ou áreas correlatas;
  2. Experiência comprovada com Tableau e Looker Platform, incluindo desenvolvimento e migração de dashboards e relatórios;
  3. Sólido conhecimento em LookML, para criação de modelos de dados e visualizações;
  4. Experiência prática com SQL para manipulação e extração de dados;
  5. Familiaridade com processos de ETL e integração de dados;
  6. Experiência com modelagem de dados e otimização de performance, especialmente em migração de plataformas;
  7. Capacidade de resolver problemas técnicos complexos durante a migração e ajustar modelos de dados e relatórios conforme necessário.

Na IPNET, acreditamos no trabalho híbrido para fortalecer nossa cultura e promover flexibilidade. Nossa proposta é de 2 dias de home-office por semana e 3 dias presenciais em nossos escritórios no Rio de Janeiro (Zona Portuária/Santo Cristo) ou em São Paulo (Vila Olímpia).

Nosso pacote de benefícios inclui:

  • Auxílio Refeição/Alimentação
  • Auxílio Transporte
  • Plano de Saúde
  • Plano Odontológico
  • Auxílio Home-Office
  • Auxílio Creche
  • Wellhub
  • Happy Day no mês do seu aniversário
  • Parcerias com instituições educacionais, de idiomas e acadêmicas

Se você se identificou com os requisitos, não perca tempo! Venha fazer parte de uma empresa que valoriza a inovação, onde o caos não assusta, porque somos um time unido, direto e com espírito de dono!

Desenvolvedor de Automação QA / Pesquisa e Desenvolvimento na BairesDev

Estamos a procurar excelentes Desenvolvedor de Automação QA para se juntarem à equipe de pesquisa e desenvolvimento (P&D) da BairesDev.

Nossa equipe de P&D é uma parte essencial de nossas soluções de tecnologia que geram milhões em receita todos os anos, por isso contratamos apenas os melhores dos melhores.

Dentro da equipe, você encontrará muitos desafios diferentes: análise de dados, aprendizado de máquina, desktop e desenvolvimentos web são alguns dos mais relevantes no momento, mas para impulsionar a inovação, você notará que novidades estão surgindo todos os dias!

A área de P&D é sem dúvida a área mais excitante e desafiante de toda a empresa. Apesar de pessoas realmente talentosas, em geral, formarem a BairesDev, aqui você encontra profissionais com larga experiência e também níveis intelectual e criativo muito acima da média.

Queremos que as pessoas aproveitem a viagem. Você está pronto?

- Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com os desenvolvedores para criar casos de teste, projetar planos de teste e automatizar casos de teste para a verificação da funcionalidade do produto.

- Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com os Desenvolvedores, Product Owners e Scrum Masters para revisar os requisitos e o design do produto.

- Gerenciar e rastrear Bugs e Melhorias (via JIRA e ferramentas aplicáveis).

- Investigar e analisar defeitos do produto.

- Desenvolver e implementar a estratégia de Automação de Testes.

- Gerar scripts de teste automatizados de nível de API usando várias tecnologias e ferramentas.

Esperamos que você tenha:

- 4+ anos de experiência em testes automatizados.

- Bons conhecimentos em C, C++, Java e Python.

- Profundo conhecimento de ambientes Unix e Linux.

- Nível avançado de inglês.

Como tornamos seu trabalho (e sua vida) mais fácil:

- Modalidade 100% remota - trabalhe de qualquer lugar.

- Excelente remuneração em USD ou na sua moeda local, como preferir.

- Hardware para você trabalhar de casa.

title: Farmacêutico clínico
description:
Analista de Recursos Humanos | RH | Recursos Humanos | Recrutamento e Seleção | Talent Acquisition

Local de Atuação: Clínica DPSP - Catete, RJ.

Necessário experiências com Vacinas e Serviços Farmacêuticos.

Quais serão seus desafios?

  1. Garantir as boas práticas farmacêuticas de acordo com as normas, legislações e procedimentos internos;
  2. Realizar a assistência farmacêutica aos clientes;
  3. Manter organizada e atualizada a documentação técnica relacionada à saúde da clínica;
  4. Manter impresso, atualizado e multiplicar os colaboradores em relação aos procedimentos operacionais padrão da empresa (POP´s) e Manual de Boas Práticas (MBPF);
  5. Cumprir com os procedimentos internos e legais na realização de serviços farmacêuticos e/ou de imunização humana;
  6. Acompanhar os comunicados de recolhimento e verificação de produtos das salas de serviços de saúde, garantindo a retirada destes da área de vendas e a devolução aos Centros de Distribuição (CD);
  7. Auxiliar em Reuniões de Piso;
  8. Esclarecer dúvidas técnicas de clientes e funcionários da loja;
  9. Garantir o cumprimento de procedimentos técnico-legais, como armazenamento de produtos e condições de temperatura.

Na nossa equipe, valorizamos a diversidade e acreditamos que as diferenças enriquecem nossa receita. Aqui, todos são bem-vindos, pois o mais importante é você ser quem realmente deseja ser!

Requisitos:

  1. Formação superior em Farmácia;
  2. Pós-graduação em Farmácia Clínica ou Prescrição Farmacêutica;
  3. Experiência de 6 meses ou mais atuando em loja com serviço de vacinação;
  4. Certificação em Vacinação, incluindo cursos específicos de imunização e aplicação de vacinas;
  5. Conhecimento das normas e legislações sanitárias relacionadas à vacinação;
  6. Capacidade de realizar triagem clínica e avaliação de contraindicações para vacinação;
  7. Boa comunicação para esclarecer dúvidas dos pacientes;
  8. Capacidade de trabalhar em equipe e colaborar com outros profissionais de saúde.

Horário de Trabalho: 13:40 às 22:00

title: Business Development Specialist
description:
Brunel Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

Brunel Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

A Brunel está em busca de um(a) Market Development Specialist para atuar junto a um de nossos clientes, uma grande empresa do setor de petróleo e gás! Essa oportunidade seria para atuar em um contrato indeterminado, via Brunel, de forma 100% presencial no escritório localizado no Rio de Janeiro (RJ).

Estamos em busca de um(a) profissional com profundo conhecimento da indústria brasileira de petróleo offshore, novas energias e engenharia (petróleo e gás, energia eólica offshore, construção naval, infraestrutura portuária, etc.). Você será responsável por identificar oportunidades de negócios, construir parcerias estratégicas e impulsionar a conquista de projetos no Brasil e na América do Sul.

Principais Responsabilidades:

  • Pesquisar o mercado brasileiro de petróleo offshore e engenharia, a concorrência e as regulamentações (por exemplo, ANP, IBAMA, regras de Conteúdo Local).
  • Desenvolver estratégias de entrada/expansão no mercado para segmentos-alvo (por exemplo, petróleo e gás em águas profundas, cadeia de suprimentos de energia eólica offshore).
  • Coletar e monitorar informações sobre o mercado brasileiro de petróleo offshore e engenharia, informações sobre licitações especiais;
  • Interagir com clientes-chave e partes interessadas governamentais.
  • Manter parcerias de longo prazo com players do setor (estaleiros, fornecedores de equipamentos, empresas de engenharia).
  • Acompanhar licitações brasileiras (por exemplo, campos de petróleo do PRESAL, energia eólica offshore ou outras áreas com potencial) e liderar iniciativas pré-licitação.
  • Colaborar com as equipes técnicas para desenvolver soluções personalizadas.

Requisitos:

  • Graduação em engenharia ou administração (por exemplo, petróleo offshore ou engenharia, MBA).
  • Experiência em desenvolvimento do mercado de petróleo offshore ou na área de engenharia nos setores de petróleo e gás offshore, engenharia naval ou energia renovável do Brasil,
  • Familiaridade com clientes-chave da indústria
  • Fluência em português e inglês (essencial para negociações multinacionais).
  • Sólido conhecimento da cultura empresarial brasileira, processos governamentais e regulamentações do setor.
  • Sólidas habilidades de negociação e redação de propostas.

title: Contract & Service Coordinator
description:
Join to apply for the Contract & Service Coordinator role at Accelleron

1 week ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join to apply for the Contract & Service Coordinator role at Accelleron

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

Direct message the job poster from Accelleron

At Accelleron, we innovate turbocharging technologies that accelerate growth at sea, on land and beyond. #movefurther

Accelleron is accelerating sustainability in the marine and energy industries as a global technology leader in turbocharging, fuel injection, and digital solutions for heavy-duty applications. Building on a heritage of over 100 years as a trusted industry partner, the company serves customers in more than 100 locations in over 50 countries. Accelleron’s 3,000 employees are continuously innovating to deliver best-in-class products, services, and solutions that are mission-critical for the energy transition. You will join a team of experts in an exciting international environment, committed to excellence and innovation. Together, we support our customers in driving the transition toward sustainable industries with cutting-edge technology, deep expertise, and smart solutions. At Accelleron, we foster diversity and inclusion, welcoming and celebrating individual differences as a source of strength.

Your responsibilities

  • Contract Management: Manages customer satisfaction by ensuring that Accelleron fulfils its contractual obligations and business requirements. Ensures the required quality is delivered and the health, safety and environmental issues are competently managed. Reviews the scope of the work and ensures that all parties fulfil their contractual obligations, particularly regarding claims and changes.
  • Manage customer contracts from the sales handover, preparing the contract in the systems, conducting the kickoff meeting with the customer, and maintaining continuous communication with the customer's counterpart. Must keep records of executions, planned versus actual progress, cost control, and customer feedback, all in accordance with Accelleron's rules and procedures. Be able to negotiate with customers regarding deviations in the scope modifications of services and sales contracts, integrating various internal and external areas of the company, and technically reporting changes and impacts to customers.
  • Drive customer satisfaction by delivering excellent service execution, ensuring efficient resource management (service engineers, spare parts, tools).
  • Single Point for Customer: Act as the single point of contact for customers during service job execution, handling scheduling, quotations, and invoicing. Builds and maintains sustainable relationship with customer. Manages customer requirements and customer enquiries. Ensures continuous communication.
  • Coordination: Coordinates, plans, schedules, and oversees all Service jobs with necessary resources, spare parts and logistics for site. Maintain a close interface with the involved areas—Operations, Technical, Services, and Sales—through objective communication and prioritization of the execution of agreements made with customers, acting as the point of contact for the customer during service execution. Plan together with clients the needs for the execution of services (infrastructure, logistics, among others) to ensure the proper implementation of maintenance contracts, optimizing resources, informing, and negotiating in case of any deviations.
  • Service Order Process: Manages the Service order process in a timely manner from quotation to invoicing and cash collection.
  • Reporting & Documentation: Manages all required reporting and documentation. Ensures all necessary data has been registered in a timely manner in the system.
  • Compliance: Ensure the implementation and updating of the area's internal procedures and controls, identifying and mitigating operational risks. Promote a culture of Health, Workplace Safety, Integrity, Ethics, and Operational Excellence.
  • One Accelleron: Cooperates and coordinates activities with other Accelleron units and teams to harmonize service activities and to maximize service sales at every opportunity. Ensures the transfer of Service findings to the product / system local business units for improvement of their offerings.

Your background

  • 2-3 years experience coordinating service teams, on mechanical or maintenance areas. Desirable experience on Marine, Offshore and Powerplant segments.
  • Proven experience on leading and managing maintenance / binding contracts with customers, dealing with documentation, deliverables, reporting, negotiations.
  • Knowledge of SAP or similar ERP / CRM systems.
  • The ability to spend approximately 10 to 20 days travelling to domestic locations in Brazil.
  • Proven leadership skills, with a collaborative, solution-focused approach.
  • Strong written and spoken communication skills.
  • Proven good English Skills (written and spoken)
  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration required. Desirable Mechanical or Industrial Engineering.
  • Credit Union.
  • Global Fitness Platform (Wellhub).
  • Profit Sharing.
  • Health Plan.
  • Life Insurance.

We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about Accelleron, take another look at our website accelleron.com.

About The Role

We’re looking for a proactive, results-driven Operations Associate with a background in sales or account management—particularly someone who has sold website development services to U.S.-based clients. This role supports day-to-day operations, sales pipeline management, and client success initiatives in a fast-paced, globally distributed team.

You’ll collaborate closely with the CEO (based in California) and help bridge strategy and execution across departments. If you thrive in a high-impact role, are highly organized, and understand the nuances of digital services sales and delivery, we want to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support end-to-end operations, including sales enablement, CRM upkeep, reporting, and process optimization.
  • Act as a liaison between sales and delivery teams, ensuring client expectations and timelines are aligned.
  • Monitor and manage the client onboarding process post-sale, ensuring a smooth handoff and service delivery.
  • Provide internal support to the CEO, helping prioritize tasks, prepare reports, and coordinate initiatives.
  • Collaborate on proposals, quotes, and contracts for web development services.
  • Assist in managing project timelines, communications, and status updates across global teams.
  • Identify gaps or inefficiencies in workflows and propose solutions to improve operations.

Required Qualifications

  • 2+ years of professional experience,
  • Direct experience selling or managing website development services for U.S.-based clients.
  • Strong communication skills and comfort interacting with stakeholders at all levels, especially C-level.
  • Proven ability to work independently, prioritize multiple tasks, and adapt in a fast-paced remote environment.
  • Familiarity with tools like HubSpot, Trello, Slack, Notion, Google Workspace, or similar.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Knowledge of digital project lifecycles, especially in web design, development, or digital marketing.
  • Background in operations, project coordination, or client success.
  • Bilingual or multilingual communication skills.

Why Join Us?

  • Work 100% remotely from anywhere in the world.
  • Collaborate with a globally diverse and talented team.
  • Contribute directly to company growth, scalability, and client satisfaction.
  • Flexible working hours with a core overlap in Pacific Time (California-based leadership).

Ready to take ownership of operations in a growth-focused digital services company?

Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume detailing their relevant experience.

Compensation Range: $12K - $16.8K

title: Assistente/Analista Knowledge Management (A&M Infra) - Vaga Afirmativa PcD
description:
Descrição

Sobre a Alvarez & Marsal

A Alvarez & Marsal (A&M) é uma consultoria global com mais de 10.000 profissionais em mais de 40 países. Adotamos uma abordagem prática para resolver os problemas de nossos clientes e ajudá-los a atingir seu pleno potencial. Nossa cultura valoriza pensadores independentes e realizadores, com um ambiente colaborativo e valores centrais como Integridade, Qualidade, Objetividade, Diversão, Recompensa Pessoal e Diversidade Inclusiva.

A Equipe

A A&M Infra atua em todas as fases de projetos de infraestrutura, incluindo mineração, portos, óleo & gás, aeroportos, siderurgia, ferrovias, papel & celulose, rodovias, energia, telecomunicações, saneamento e imóveis. Envolvemos-nos desde a estruturação de projetos até a gestão de ativos.

Como você poderá contribuir

  • Manter o sistema de Gestão de Conhecimento atualizado e acessível.
  • Interagir com líderes, sócios e diretores para entender as expectativas e adaptar os processos de KM.
  • Utilizar ferramentas como Power BI e Power Apps para criar dashboards e melhorar o acompanhamento de dados.
  • Revisar traduções de documentos, garantindo precisão e clareza.

Qualificações

  • Formação em Engenharia da Computação, Tecnologia da Informação, Sistemas de Informação, Administração, Economia ou áreas relacionadas.
  • Boa capacidade analítica e de raciocínio estruturado.
  • Habilidades de comunicação escrita e oral.
  • Conhecimento em BI e Power Apps será um diferencial.
  • Inglês intermediário a avançado (opcional).

Sua jornada na A&M

Valorizamos o desenvolvimento contínuo, oferecendo treinamentos de alta qualidade, oportunidades de crescimento e benefícios que apoiam sua jornada pessoal. Nosso ambiente promove meritocracia, aprendizado prático e uma cultura empreendedora e divertida.

Diversidade & Inclusão

Promovemos uma cultura de diversidade e inclusão, incentivando todos a trazerem seu eu completo ao trabalho, refletindo em nossas práticas de recrutamento, desenvolvimento e parcerias.

Empregador de Oportunidades Iguais

A&M oferece oportunidades iguais de emprego, sem discriminação por raça, gênero, orientação sexual, deficiência, entre outros, em conformidade com a lei.

Currículos Não Solicitados de Recrutadores de Terceiros

Não aceitamos currículos não solicitados de recrutadores de terceiros, a menos que contratados especificamente para uma vaga, conforme nossa política de diversidade e inclusão. Envio não autorizado implica em entendimento de que a contratação é a critério da A&M, sem taxas devidas.

description:
Job description

Nós somos a Quality Digital ! Saiba mais sobre a gente:

  • Uma frase que nos define - Somos especialistas em soluções de TI e apaixonados por inovação!
  • Ao infinito e além - Somos #semfronteiras . Nosso time está espalhado pelo Brasil e pelo mundo
  • Nossa cultura - Mesmo distantes, estamos juntos Temos cerimônias para estarmos mais próximos, compartilhar conhecimento e ficar por dentro das novidades da nossa empresa!
  • Somos diversos - Um dos nossos compromissos é fazer da companhia um ambiente cada vez mais diverso, inclusivo e respeitoso, valorizando e promovendo a pluralidade. Por isso, aqui temos espaço para todas as pessoas, independente de raça, gênero, idade, orientação sexual, crença religiosa ou deficiência. ️????
  • Nosso objetivo - Potencializar os negócios dos nossos clientes através de soluções inovadoras e sustentáveis. Topa vir com a gente nessa?


Main responsibilities

O que buscamos?

Uma pessoa proativa, comprometida e com bom relacionamento interpessoal.

Como será o seu dia a dia:

  • Atendimento receptivo de chamados de 2º nível, seguindo procedimentos e prazos acordados;
  • Suporte presencial e remoto a usuários, abrangendo microinformática e periféricos (desktops, notebooks, tablets, totens, impressoras, projetores, scanners, leitores, entre outros);
  • Instalação e configuração de softwares, sistemas operacionais e aplicativos;
  • Instalação e configuração de hardwares e periféricos diversos;
  • Diagnóstico e resolução de falhas de hardware/software, com acionamento de fornecedores e times internos quando necessário;
  • Suporte a sistemas operacionais, pacote Office, navegadores, redes e utilitários do ambiente Profarma;
  • Identificação, investigação e reporte de problemas recorrentes;
  • Registro completo dos chamados e atividades realizadas, garantindo rastreabilidade;
  • Instalação de imagem em equipamentos com garantia de restauração completa dos sistemas anteriores;
  • Manutenção preventiva dos sistemas e equipamentos;
  • Criação e atualização da base de conhecimento técnico;
  • Execução de scripts e procedimentos técnicos para diagnóstico e suporte;
  • Atendimento por telefone, chat, acesso remoto e presencial;
  • Suporte a videoconferência e instalação de equipamentos multimídia;
  • Remanejamento de pontos de rede e equipamentos (mooving);
  • Cadastro de novos equipamentos no inventário;
  • Gestão de chamados com controle de SLA;
  • Suporte à conectividade com a internet e mudanças de layout;
  • Realização de aceite com o usuário no atendimento de incidentes e solicitações;
  • Cumprimento das normas e diretrizes do cliente.


Requirements and skills
  • Ensino médio completo
  • Conhecimento em Troubleshooting de Redes, Microinformática, Software e Hardware, ferramentas de Service Desk, Sistemas Operacionais e Pacote Office.

Serão diferenciais

  • Cursando superior na área de Tecnologia.

description:
Job description

Responsável por desenvolver, construir, manter e otimizar arquiteturas de dados, garantindo a disponibilidade e a qualidade dos dados para análises e operações de negócios.

title: Python and Kubernetes Software Engineer - Data, Workflows, AI/ML & Analytics
description:
Python and Kubernetes Software Engineer - Data, Workflows, AI/ML & AnalyticsJoin or sign in to find your next job

Join to apply for the Python and Kubernetes Software Engineer - Data, Workflows, AI/ML & Analytics role at Canonical

Python and Kubernetes Software Engineer - Data, Workflows, AI/ML & Analytics

1 day ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join to apply for the Python and Kubernetes Software Engineer - Data, Workflows, AI/ML & Analytics role at Canonical

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing. We are hiring Python and Kubernetes Specialist Engineers focused on Data, Workflows, AI/ML and Analytics Solutions to join our teams building open source solutions for public cloud and private infrastructure.

As a software engineer on the team, you'll collaborate on end-to-end data analytics and MLOps solutions composed of popular, open-source, machine learning tools, such as Kubeflow, MLFlow, DVC, and Feast. You may also work on ETL, data governance and visualization tools like Apache SuperSet, dbt, workflow orchestration tools such as Airflow and Temporal, or data warehouse solutions such as Apache Trino, or ClickHouse. These solutions may be run on servers or on the cloud, on machines or on Kubernetes, on developer desktops, or as web services.

We serve the needs of individuals and community members as much as the needs of our Global 2000 and Fortune 500 customers; we make our primary work available free of charge and our Pro subscriptions are also available to individuals for personal use at no cost. Our goal is to enable more people to enjoy the benefits of open source, regardless of their circumstances.

Location: This initiative spans many teams that are home-based and in multiple time zones. We believe in distributed collaboration but we also try to ensure that colleagues have company during their work hours! Successful candidates will join a team where most members and your manager are broadly in the same time zone so that you have the benefits of constant collaboration and discussion.

What your day will look like

  • Develop your understanding of the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, and storage, to the application layer
  • Design, build and maintain solutions that will be deployed on public and private clouds and local workstations
  • Master distributed systems concepts such as observability, identity, tracing
  • Work with both Kubernetes and machine-oriented open source applications
  • Collaborate proactively with a distributed team of engineers, designers and product managers
  • Debug issues and interact in public with upstream and Ubuntu communities
  • Generate and discuss ideas, and collaborate on finding good solutions

What we are looking for in you

  • Professional or academic software delivery using Python
  • Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
  • Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
  • Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
  • Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
  • Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
  • The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
  • Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
  • Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
  • Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
  • Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
  • Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
  • Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long

Additional skills that would be nice to have

The following skills may be helpful to you in the role, but we don't expect everyone to bring all of them.

  • Proven track record of building highly automated machine learning solutions, data pipelines, or orchestrating workflows for the cloud.
  • Hands-on experience with machine learning libraries, or tools.
  • Experience with container technologies (Docker, LXD, Kubernetes, etc.)
  • Experience with public clouds (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
  • Working knowledge of cloud computing
  • Passionate about software quality and testing
  • Experience working on an open source project

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

  • Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
  • Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
  • Annual compensation review
  • Recognition rewards
  • Annual holiday leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
  • Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events

AgileEngine is one of the Inc. 5000 fastest-growing companies in the US and a top-3 ranked dev shop according to Clutch. We create award-winning custom software solutions that help companies across 15+ industries change the lives of millions.

If you like a challenging environment where you’re working with the best and are encouraged to learn and experiment every day, there’s no better place - guaranteed! :)

THE BENEFITS OF JOINING US

title: Engineering Manager - Public Cloud, Python, Golang
description:
Engineering Manager - Public Cloud, Python, GolangJoin or sign in to find your next job

Join to apply for the Engineering Manager - Public Cloud, Python, Golang role at Canonical

Engineering Manager - Public Cloud, Python, Golang

1 day ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join to apply for the Engineering Manager - Public Cloud, Python, Golang role at Canonical

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.

We are hiring an Engineering Manager to lead one of our teams that work closely with Amazon, Microsoft, Google and other world-class cloud partners to optimize Ubuntu for their infrastructure. Our team builds, tests, and publishes the base Ubuntu images used by millions to ensure optimal performance and security in their cloud estate. We aim to deliver the very best public cloud VM experience, as well as specialized images for specific purposes on each cloud. Our goal is to celebrate and enable their particular points of differentiation on their clouds, while also ensure a common operating experience for their users.

As an engineering manager you need to bring both technical and management skills to the leadership of your team. You will also need to represent the team in direct partner engagement. You'll be responsible for the stability and functionality that our cloud users have come to expect. You will strive to automate the delivery of existing and new Ubuntu image products applied to all modern workloads from web servers to GPU-aided AI for servers, VM's and containers.

As an engineering manager at Canonical your primary responsibility is to the people you support: ensuring that they are growing as engineers, doing valuable work, and generally having a great time at Canonical. As a lead for strong engineers, technical leadership and a solid background in software development is a must, so that you're able to challenge and grow your team members. You will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.

We work in Python and Golang, and expect engineering managers to be fluent in the language, architecture and components that their team is building with. Code reviews and architectural leadership are part of the job. As manager, the commitment to healthy engineering practices, documentation, quality and performance optimisation are equally important technical responsibilities, as is the requirement for fair and clear management, and the obligation to ensure a high performing team.

The role entails

  • Build and lead a team of engineers in your and similar timezones
  • Develop talent through coaching, mentoring, feedback and hands-on career development
  • Demonstrate sound engineering principles and directly contribute toward your team's goals
  • Set and manage expectations with other engineering teams, management, and external stakeholders
  • Lead modern, agile software development practices
  • Ensure a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
  • Be an active part of the leadership team and collaborate with other leaders in the organisation
  • Build automated, highly reliable image delivery, testing and publication pipelines
  • Engage with many other teams at Canonical, as well as the open source community and commercial partners
  • Work from home with global travel up to 15% for internal and external events

What we are looking for in you

  • You love to mentor, develop and grow people, and have a track record of doing it
  • You are knowledgeable and passionate about software development
  • You are focused on success and the delivery of timely, high quality software
  • You have experience and commitment to agile development methodologies
  • You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
  • Software development experience in Python or Golang
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Practical experience with at least one of Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, or AWS

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

  • Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
  • Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
  • Annual compensation review
  • Recognition rewards
  • Annual holiday leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
  • Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
  • Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

description:

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

At BairesDev, we've been leading the way in technology projects for over 15 years. We deliver cutting-edge solutions to giants like Google and the most innovative startups in Silicon Valley.

Our diverse 4,000+ team, composed of the world's Top 1% of tech talent, works remotely on roles that drive significant impact worldwide.

When you apply for this position, you're taking the first step in a process that goes beyond the ordinary. We aim to align your passions and skills with our vacancies, setting you on a path to exceptional career development and success.

UX Writer / R+D at BairesDev

We are looking for outstanding UX Writers to join BairesDev’s Research & Development Team (R&D).

Our R&D team is essential to our technology solutions that drive millions in revenue annually, so we only hire the best of the best. Within the team, you’ll find many challenges: Data analysis, Machine Learning, Desktop, and web developments are some of the most relevant right now, but to drive innovation, you’ll notice that new things are coming up every day!

The R&D area is undoubtedly the company's most exciting and challenging area. Although BairesDev is generally composed of talented people, here you will find professionals with extensive experience and high levels of intellectual and creative capacity.

We want people to enjoy the journey. Are you ready?

What You Will Do:
  1. Create effective and compelling online content (microcopy, labels, page body copy, error messages, tooltips, help articles, emails, documents, and announcements).
  2. Content creation for portal products, software applications, and user communications. Proofread content for grammar, style, and tone of voice.
  3. Collaborate with UX and UI designers, applying content design principles to craft delightful and effortless UX experiences - well-balanced layouts with fine-tuned copy.
  4. Optimize the performance of UX writing via user testing and data validation.
  5. Combine data-driven and user-centric methodologies for better results.
  6. Collaborate with product owners, developers, and designers to translate business goals into the unique brand and product experiences.
  7. Be part of all project lifecycle phases, including requirements gathering, user analysis, testing, implementation, and result-in analysis.
Here’s what we are looking for:
  1. 4+ years of UX content experience.
  2. A great team player, experienced in working with agile teams.
  3. Knowledge of Microsoft Office products: Word, Excel, and Outlook.
How we make your work (and your life) easier:
  1. 100% remote work (from anywhere).
  2. Excellent compensation in USD or your local currency if preferred.
  3. Hardware and software setup for you to work from home.
  4. Flexible hours: create your own schedule.
  5. Paid parental leaves, vacations, and national holidays.
  6. Innovative and multicultural work environment: collaborate and learn from the global Top 1% of talent.
  7. Supportive environment with mentorship, promotions, skill development, and diverse growth opportunities.

Apply now and become part of a global team where your talents can truly thrive!

description:

2 days ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join to apply for the Senior Account Executive role at Growth Troops

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

This range is provided by Growth Troops. Your actual pay will be based on your skills and experience — talk with your recruiter to learn more.

Base pay range

Remote – EST Working Hours | Competitive Compensation Based on Experience | Venture-Backed Startup

About The Company

Join a rapidly growing, venture-backed startup headquartered in New York City that is transforming how enterprise organizations optimize their advertising investments. Our platform is designed for brands managing over $1M in annual ad spend and seeking to enhance campaign performance through cutting-edge technology. Backed by top-tier investors, we are building a world-class go-to-market (GTM) team comprised of high-caliber talent eager to make a meaningful impact.

About The Role

We are seeking an experienced Senior Account Executive with a strong background in enterprise software sales, particularly within high-growth, US-based venture-backed companies. This role is full-cycle—from initial prospecting to deal close—so we’re looking for someone who excels in dynamic startup environments, can effectively develop and close pipeline, and has a proven ability to navigate complex sales processes with large enterprise clients.

Responsibilities

  • Drive the complete sales process: prospecting, discovery, product demonstration, proposal development, negotiation, and closing.
  • Sell multi-year, multi-seat contracts to large enterprise customers across various industries.
  • Cultivate relationships with senior stakeholders in marketing, data, and procurement departments.
  • Maintain an accurate sales pipeline and forecasts using Salesforce and HubSpot.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Marketing, Product, and Customer Success teams to iterate and improve the sales motion.
  • Utilize Gong.io to analyze sales calls, refine messaging, and share learnings with the broader team.
  • Contribute to the development of our sales strategy and go-to-market positioning as an early member of the sales organization.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 6 years’ experience as an Account Executive at a US-based, venture-funded SaaS company.
  • Demonstrated success selling enterprise software to large organizations, with a history of closing multi-seat, multi-year agreements.
  • Proficient in managing the full sales cycle, from outbound prospecting to contract execution.
  • Experience with sales platforms and tools such as Salesforce, HubSpot, and Gong.io.
  • Familiarity with the advertising technology ecosystem, including:
  • Advertising solutions,
  • Ad performance analytics, or
  • Data platforms supporting media buying.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Comfortable working flexible startup hours aligned with the Eastern Time Zone.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience at an early-stage company where you contributed to building the sales playbook.
  • Prior success selling into marketing, analytics, or data science departments.
  • History of closing contracts valued at $100K+ ARR.

title: Analista Comercial (foco em Turismo)
description:
Ao se juntar ao Grupo Cataratas, você fará parte de uma empresa que tem em seu DNA a sustentabilidade, a diversidade e a inovação, e que se esforça para deixar um legado duradouro de impacto positivo no mundo.

Aqui não nos limitamos a simplesmente oferecer um emprego, mas sim a proporcionar uma experiência significativa e enriquecedora para nossos Embaixadores. Não é atoa que hoje somos reconhecidos como um excelente lugar para se trabalhar por nossos Embaixadores, certificados pela GPTW, FIA-UOL e Valor Carreira.

Como será o seu dia-a-dia (Responsabilidades):
• Prospecção ativa de clientes (B2B e/ou B2C), visando geração de novos negócios;
• Identificação de mercados e segmentos com potencial, buscando expandir a atuação comercial da empresa;
• Gestão de carteira de clientes, com foco em manutenção e expansão do relacionamento;
• Elaboração de propostas comerciais personalizadas, negociação de preços, prazos e condições;
• Acompanhamento de metas e KPIs, como taxa de conversão, ticket médio, tempo de resposta, entre outros;
• Alinhamento com áreas internas (marketing, operações e pós-venda), colaborando na entrega de soluções mais aderentes às necessidades dos clientes;
• Participação no fechamento de contratos, podendo acompanhar a implantação dos serviços vendidos.

O que você precisa ter (Requisitos):

Vale-Alimentação

Aniversariantes do Mês

Desde 1999, o Grupo Cataratas atua com excelência na gestão e operação de experiências transformadoras em parques e atrações turísticas, sendo a principal empresa de Turismo Sustentável do Brasil.

Atualmente estamos com operações em sete parques, entre eles, os parques naturais, de vida animal e temáticos - Cataratas do Iguaçu, EcoNoronha, Paineiras-Corcovado, AquaRio, Marco das Três Fronteiras, BioParque do Rio e Jericoacoara, que impactam mais de 5,5 milhões de visitantes por ano. O próximo passo é a abertura do AquaFoz, que tem previsão de inauguração em 2025.

O Grupo Cataratas, através de seus atrativos, busca criar e promover um legado duradouro de impacto positivo. Somos feitos de gente para gente. Cuidamos do bem-estar dos nossos embaixadores para poder ressignificar a relação das pessoas com a natureza por meio de experiências verdadeiramente transformadoras, proporcionando visitações que divertem e conscientizam ao mesmo tempo.

Afinal, assim como a natureza, estamos em constante evolução. Atuamos através dos pilares de Educação, Pesquisa, Conservação e Entretenimento tendo a Sustentabilidade, Diversidade e Inovação como parte do nosso DNA.

Se identificou com os nossos valores? Venha fazer parte da maior empresa de Turismo Sustentável do Brasil!

title: Consultor de investimentos
description:
A Cosme Futures é uma empresa portuguesa especializada na gestão de investimentos financeiros. Atuamos no mercado europeu e oferecemos aos nossos clientes rentabilidades acima da média através de estratégias sólidas e transparentes.

O que procuramos:

Estamos à procura de consultores comerciais altamente motivados, com perfil empreendedor, para atuarem na captação de investidores. A função é 100% comissionada e pode ser exercida de forma totalmente remota, com ganhos em euros .

Responsabilidades:

  • Criar as próprias leads (clientes interessados) através de estratégias como marketing digital, redes sociais, networking ou contactos pessoais.
  • Apresentar o serviço de gestão de investimentos oferecido pela empresa.
  • Acompanhar e orientar os investidores interessados até à assinatura do contrato.
  • Participar nas formações e alinhamentos com a equipa.

O que oferecemos:

  • Comissões atrativas: entre 5% e 10% por investimento fechado (valores entre 5.000€ e 20.000€).
  • Bónus adicionais por metas atingidas (até 1.500€ mensais extra).
  • Formação contínua e suporte da equipa.
  • Possibilidade de crescimento dentro da empresa.
  • Capacidade de trabalhar de forma autónoma.
  • Acesso à internet e ferramentas digitais básicas.
  • Experiência em vendas, investimentos ou marketing será valorizada (mas não obrigatória).

???? Como candidatar-se:

Clique em “Candidatar-se” e envia-nos o teu perfil atualizado. As entrevistas serão realizadas por videochamada.

Observação:

Esta função não oferece salário fixo. Todos os ganhos são com base em comissões, com potencial elevado de rendimento para quem se empenhar.
